result.execSummary:
The defendant Mikael J Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KW, SSN & DCN.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 successful completion of probation, restitution pd & no new charges.

Continue to reside at Dignity House or another house approved by agent. Complete 100 hrs of community services in first yr.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
